title: IRC Archive for channel #xwiki - XWiki
content:
00:55  has joined #xwiki 00:57  has quit 01:11 <@sdumitriu> !news 01:19  has quit 01:35  has quit 01:37 <+jvelociter> hi cjdelisle 01:37 <+jvelociter> Are you there ? 01:39 <@sdumitriu> Doubt it 01:45 <@sdumitriu> jvelociter: Jira down? 01:45 <@sdumitriu> Are you upgrading it? 01:45 <+jvelociter> not down, but there are been some DNS changes tonight 01:45 <+jvelociter> let me ask Alex 01:51 <+jvelociter> sdumitriu: Alex fixed it, it should be alright in a couple of minutes 03:01 <+jvelociter> sdumitriu: we could actually change the signature of createUserFromLDAP to make it void 03:02 <@sdumitriu> Yep 03:02 <+jvelociter> I don't know why I missed the variable assignment was completly useless 03:44  has joined #xwiki 03:45  has quit 03:45  has joined #xwiki 04:35  has quit 04:49  has joined #xwiki 04:58  has quit 05:57  has quit 06:03  has quit 06:09  has joined #xwiki 06:28  has joined #xwiki 06:29  good morning 06:33 <@sdumitriu> Hm, it's morning already? 06:33 <@sdumitriu> Good morning 06:33  yes almost bed time for you! :) 06:37  thanks for my missing @since.... 06:39  myxwiki is very slow…. I see it has rebooted during the night 06:53 <@sdumitriu> 3 times 06:57  and again now 07:31  has joined #xwiki 07:56  has joined #xwiki 08:00  has quit 08:02  has quit 08:16  has joined #xwiki 08:37  has joined #xwiki 08:38  good morning 08:41  has joined #xwiki 08:56  has joined #xwiki 08:59  has quit 09:01  has joined #xwiki 09:02  has quit 09:09  has joined #xwiki 09:14 <@cjdelisle> sdumitriu: "I'll look at the code to verify it's OK soon." Are you asking me to keep it out of the main tree until you say otherwise? 09:14 <@sdumitriu> No 09:15 <@sdumitriu> Commit it, I'll read sometime later 09:15  has joined #xwiki 09:15 <@cjdelisle> Ok, thanks 09:26  has joined #xwiki 09:37  mflorea: could it be http://jira.xwiki.org/jira/browse/XWIKI-5186 ? 09:39  yes that's it 09:39  commenting 09:39 <+mflorea> vmassol: ok 09:41 <+mflorea> do we close XWIKI-3091 as duplicate? I can open a new issue for the closing id macro bug 09:41  mflorea: see http://jira.xwiki.org/jira/browse/XWIKI-3091?focusedCommentId=57592&page=com.atlassian.jira.plugin.system.issuetabpanels%3Acomment-tabpanel#action\_57592 09:41  can you do it? 09:41 <+mflorea> vmassol: yep 09:41  ok cool 09:44 <@cjdelisle> Has the idea of doing an xwiki-commons package been discussed? 09:44  FYI I'm working on generic markers (aka metadata support) today (for implementing the source metadata) 09:44  (note that this is different from generic markers for transformations which would be implemented by storing original blocks in the XDOM) 09:45  cjdelisle: depends what you'd put inside, right now we do have commons modules but they each have a "meaning" 09:45  like for example xwiki-xml 09:45  (if by package you mean module) 09:45 <@cjdelisle> By commons I mean like apache-commons, things which have mimimal or no dependencies. 09:45 <@cjdelisle> yes, module 09:45  what does this mean? 09:45  compared to what we already have 09:46 <@cjdelisle> Actually module might not be right. 09:46  or do you mean jarjar? 09:46 <@cjdelisle> As an alternatice to xwiki-core. 09:46 <@cjdelisle> hehe 09:46 <@cjdelisle> not that core. 09:46 <@cjdelisle> A module with submodules 09:46  no I mean something like xwiki-rendering-standalone 09:47  is that what you mean? 09:47 <@cjdelisle> That sounds like what I'm thinking of. 09:47  (note: we're using the shade plugin to generate it) 09:47 <@cjdelisle> (haven't read it) 09:47 <@cjdelisle> The thinking is #1 people can easily add commons modules to their project (so no dependency injection) 09:48  cjdelisle: the only use case is for people not using maven, ivy, gradle, ant, etc 09:48  (since those just need one dep declaration) 09:48 <@cjdelisle> Ahh, I was thinking of it being for people using maven but who only want one xwiki module. 09:49  then they jsut depend on ot 09:49  s/ot/it/ 09:49   09:49 <@cjdelisle> So only for things which don't need xwiki-model xwiki-component etc. 09:49  yes we discussed that 09:49  and agreed we didn't want it 09:49  I even tried doing it 09:50  for a while 09:50  it was just too complex to maintain 09:50  with no real advantage 09:50 <@cjdelisle> Can you give me a word to search for to find the email thread? 09:50  the component injection of xwiki is 150 lines of code 09:50 <@cjdelisle> (I assume xwiki-commons is not what it was called.) 09:51  it was discussed especially when we discussed making the rendering module standalone 09:51  and we talked about removing the need for the dep on xwiki-component 09:52  has quit 09:52 <@cjdelisle> I probably shouldn't push it until I have read the email thread but I think that for small things ("primitives") which don't have need for dependencies, it wouldn't be too difficult. 09:52  but it doesn't make much sense in practice. What would make sense is to change injection from field injection to method/constructor but so far we decided not to do that 09:53  has joined #xwiki 09:53  yes it's not too diffcult for those but pretty useless 09:53 <@cjdelisle> And #1 people can (and are likely to) use a module with no dependencies, #2 people using a module outside of the platform are more likely to propose patches, #3 it's free name recognision. 09:53  (they don't do anything useful and you can already depend on them) 09:54  yes but that's not xwiki 09:54  just go to apache commons 09:54  if there's no link with other xwiki modules it's not xwiki related stuff 09:54  and it should be moved to a generic location 09:55 <@cjdelisle> So I should move transation and locking out of xwiki? 09:55  and the shade plugin or jarjar is abad solution 09:55  if transaction is not using components then yes, this is why I proposed to reuse an existingframework in my mail 09:56  :) 09:56  in that case it's more generic than xwiki and has nothing to do in xwiki 09:56 <@cjdelisle> I think your assertion that it's "useless" is throwing away a golden opertunty. 09:56  xwiki would just be forge for it but without a real tie 09:57  in this case 09:57  it's more debatable for stuff that relates to wiki stuff though 09:57 <@cjdelisle> If you have a group of people deciding what enterprise wiki to use and one pipes up and says "I know the name xwiki, I used one of their modules for a project", that might seal the deal. 09:57  but then there's 100% chance that they'll use other xwiki modules one way or another 09:58  cjdelisle: there's no problem in making xwiki-transaction module not depend on any other module 09:58  now what I think you're hinting at 09:58  is to propose to make it a top level project 09:58  but I'd be ?1 till we see it committed, it's used for a while, etc 09:59 <@cjdelisle> Agreed. I like it but I agree with you there :) 09:59 <@sdumitriu> Finally, got it working... Good night 09:59 <@cjdelisle> I'm only using it as an example, I as a matter of habbit write as much code with as few dependencies as possible. 10:00 <@cjdelisle> gnight 10:00  sdumitriu: nn (not sure what's working but sounds good) 10:00  cjdelisle: sure but we need specific examples and yes I'm +1 on limiting deps 10:00 <@sdumitriu> PDF Export passing DOM Documents around instead of Strings 10:00  ok cool 10:01  (but not at the detriment of removing features that are good for us) 10:01 <@cjdelisle> So I end up with a lot of "primatives" and I often think someone else could use that, they would likely have patches for it too, and it would spread the xwiki name. 10:01  (like if you reinvent DI just not to depend on xwiki-component is bad IMO) 10:01  cjdelisle: sure, we want to do the same for the xwiki rendering engine, thart's why it can be used standalone 10:02 <@cjdelisle> hehe, I try not to reinvent anything unless I cannot find something which meets my specifications. 10:02  I mean all code in xwiki should use component wherever they can 10:02  wherever it makes sense rather 10:02  and they shouldn't not use components because they couldn't be used outside without depending on xwiki-component 10:03 <@sdumitriu> vmassol: Speaking of xwiki-xml 10:03  that would be a very bad rationale IMO 10:03 <@cjdelisle> Agreed. 10:03 <@sdumitriu> If I want to use XmlScriptService someplace else, how do I get it? 10:03 <@cjdelisle> But often I end up with "functions" which don't live very long and have their dependencies handed to them in their constructor. 10:04  sdumitriu: wdym? 10:04  someplace else = ? 10:04 <@sdumitriu> How do I get an instance of it 10:04  cm.lookup(...) 10:04 <@sdumitriu> With any other type of component I'd request it as a dependency 10:04 <@sdumitriu> But ScriptServices don't actually have an interface 10:05 <@sdumitriu> I need the exact methods in the class 10:05  hmmm this is done for being used by introspection actually 10:05 <@sdumitriu> So, I can either lookup and cast back to XmlScriptService, which is not so safe (someone might provide a different implementation for the "xml" hint) 10:06  but yes I agree 10:06 <@sdumitriu> Or I can bypass the CM and make a new instance myself 10:06  need to think about it 10:06 <@sdumitriu> Or I can make a different interface for it 10:06 <@sdumitriu> Can a component implementation implement two roles? 10:06  IF sounds the best but we need to think how it would be implemented 10:06  yes and no 10:06  if 2 roles then you'll have 2 instances 10:07 <@sdumitriu> If that's the only downside, I can live with two instances 10:07  where do you need it? 10:07 <@sdumitriu> Well, I already used it in the escapetool override 10:07  because it' not made to be reused 10:07  reused outside of scripts that is 10:08 <@sdumitriu> And I wanted to use it in PdfExportImpl, since it also needs a lot of XML handling 10:08  so you're probably using something not made to be used in this context 10:08 <@sdumitriu> Yes, I know 10:08  IMO this means we need some java APIs for what you need 10:08  (to not go through the script service) 10:09 <@sdumitriu> Hm, I wonder if Apache Commons has something for XML 10:09  we have XMLUtils for ex 10:09  seems there's overlap between both now 10:09  both = XMLUtils and XMLScriptService 10:10 <@sdumitriu> cjdelisle: Did you look at http://commons.apache.org/transaction/ ? 10:10 <@cjdelisle> I looked at their lock manager, it is primative IMO 10:11 <@cjdelisle> I wanted to use it but detecting deadlock is worst case exponential time, and it has no way to break deadlock, just rollback a thread and try again hoping it has cleared. 10:12 <@cjdelisle> Deadlock can be broken efficiently by "trading locks" and it can be detected in worst case liniar time. 10:13  cjdelisle: is their project dead? did you try to talk to them? 10:15 <@cjdelisle> I don't know. I couldn't find anyone who was implementing locks the way I wanted. 10:15 <@cjdelisle> No I didn't talk to them. 10:17  you were talking about exposure, implementing your idea in apache land in this project would get it even more attention for ex 10:18  (I'm not saying we should do that, but you might want to consider it) 10:18 <@cjdelisle> That is one path. Ofc it's a different license and the world will know it as apache instead of xwiki. 10:20 <@cjdelisle> DeadlockBreakingLock is still an infant. When I get some more time I will implement the rest of it's methods and I might write a paper about it. 10:27 <@cjdelisle> http://commons.apache.org/transaction/apidocs/org/apache/commons/transaction/AbstractTransactionalResourceManager.html#commitTransaction%28%29 10:27 <@cjdelisle> Same path: begin(); try { doStuff(); commit(); } catch (e) { rollback(); } 10:28 <@cjdelisle> Also more complex than TR, it doesn't offer what TR does but TR doesn't offer what this does. 10:29 <@cjdelisle> (doesn't offer everything that...) 10:42 <+sburjan`> hello. I have a short question. I have a 2.7 final XE. I created a simple user, and changed my profile Image. AS doesn't log that change, but the avatar gets updated in other modifications from AS. Is this normal ? 10:50  what other modifications sburjan`? 10:50 <+sburjan`> Create a page, create a space, etc .. those appear in AS .. but changing the profile Image doesnt. Is that normal ? 10:51 <@sdumitriu> No 10:52 <+sburjan`> ok. I'll investigate if it happens on 3.0 M1, if it doesn, I'll report it on JIRA affecting 2.7 10:56  has joined #xwiki 11:00  has quit 11:15 <+sburjan`> xwikibot- 5930 11:16 <+sburjan`> xwikibot- 5930 11:16 <+sburjan`> damn auto-complete 11:16 <+sburjan`> http://jira.xwiki.org/jira/browse/XWIKI-5794 11:16 <+sburjan`> http://jira.xwiki.org/jira/browse/XWIKI-5930 11:16 <+sburjan`> last one 11:16 <+sburjan`> sorry for the first, it was a bad copy/paste 11:41 <@cjdelisle> Haha I think I got it :D 11:41 <@cjdelisle> One of those bugs that disappears when I start dumping data on it. 11:42 <@cjdelisle> Schrodenger's bug 11:42  if that was a case it would both be there and not there unless you measure 11:43 <@cjdelisle> Well... It's there until I start measuring 11:43 <@cjdelisle> But the fact about measuring gives up it's secret. 11:44  at least you can know its velocity…. 11:45 <@cjdelisle> hehe 11:46 <@cjdelisle> One of the things I like about the core is it's never short on challange. 11:56  :) 12:00  has quit 12:18  has joined #xwiki 12:28  has joined #xwiki 12:29  has quit 12:48  has joined #xwiki 13:08  has quit 13:20  has joined #xwiki 13:28  has joined #xwiki 13:40  has quit 13:41  has joined #xwiki 13:43  has joined #xwiki 13:43  has quit 13:43  has joined #xwiki 13:45  has joined #xwiki 13:47  has quit 13:50 <@cjdelisle> http://myxwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Admin/Graphs 13:50 <@cjdelisle> 259 million connections per second avg? 13:51 <@cjdelisle> that looks wrong, esp. with 47kbps average push speed 13:55 <+jvelociter> yes there should be a unit mistake there 13:59 <@cjdelisle> I assume that's intended to mean "number of page loads per second", A couple other interesting metrics are the number of connections at any given time. 13:59  cjdelisle, jvelociter: would be great if you could add your analysis to the page 14:00 <@cjdelisle> lsof | grep FIN\_WAIT\_1 14:00 <@cjdelisle> lsof | grep FIN\_WAIT\_2 14:00 <@cjdelisle> lsof | grep ESTABLISHED 14:00 <@cjdelisle> ^those will give you an idea of what's happening with the tcp stack. 14:01 <@cjdelisle> those | wc -l 14:02  would be great to have stats about full HTTP request times 14:02  40ms sounds way too low to represent a full HTTP request 14:02 <@cjdelisle> ^ +1 14:03  so I'm not sure what the HTTP request times listed represent 14:05  has quit 14:08  has joined #xwiki 14:39  has quit 14:39  has joined #xwiki 14:39  is now known as 15:39  has joined #xwiki 15:50  cu 15:51  has quit 16:03  has quit 16:46  has quit 16:53  getting there…. need only 2-3 hours more to finish adding the new MetaDataBlock and the "source" metadata… :) 16:54  28 classes modified so far.... 16:58  has joined #xwiki 17:20  has quit 17:22  has joined #xwiki 17:49  has quit 17:57  has quit 18:07 <+jvelociter> what are you working on vmassol ? 18:08 <+jvelociter> markers for modified XDOM > 18:08 <+jvelociter> ? 18:08  specifically on fixing relative links/images in included documents 18:08  generically on generic metadata in the XDOM 18:08  this is different from generic markers for transformation 18:09  (that's next) 18:09  (but it's more complex) 18:09  (jvelociter) 18:09  doing a last full rebuild and then I can commit 18:09 <+jvelociter> ok 18:24  has quit 18:31  has quit 18:33  has quit 18:40  has joined #xwiki 18:47  lucaa: I have an annotation test faiing 18:47  and then I'm ready to commit 18:47  in AnnotationXHTMLRendererTest 18:48 <+lucaa> yes 18:48  Expected :

To be, or not to be, that is the question:

18:48  Actual   :

To be, or not to be, that is the question:

18:48  any idea? 18:48  I don't understand what this has to do with my fix 18:48  s/fix/change/ 18:48 <+lucaa> hmm... 18:48 <+lucaa> there's no annotation mapped at all... 18:49 <+lucaa> it's only this one failing? 18:49  yes 18:49  @Test getAnnotatedHTML() 18:49 <+lucaa> I know what it is about 18:49 <+lucaa> I mean which is the test & all 18:50 <+lucaa> but I cannot tell why it fails 18:50 <+lucaa> what did you change, again/ 18:50 <+lucaa> ? 18:50  I added begin/endMetaData events to Listener 18:50 <+lucaa> did you implement them in the annotationMapping listener 18:50 <+lucaa> or whatever its name is? 18:50  + added a new MetaDataStateChainingListener but I found that I need to add it in AbstractAnnotationRenderer 18:51  not sure what this is 18:51  I don't know the annotation code at all actually 18:51  can you point me to a location? 18:52 <+lucaa> location for what? it's in the annotation-core module 18:52 <+lucaa> (only if you promise not to review it) 18:52  what class? 18:53 <+lucaa> this would be it: 18:53 <+lucaa> https://svn.xwiki.org/svnroot/xwiki/platform/core/trunk/xwiki-annotations/xwiki-annotation-core/src/main/java/org/xwiki/annotation/renderer/ 18:53 <+lucaa> and the internals here: 18:53 <+lucaa> https://svn.xwiki.org/svnroot/xwiki/platform/core/trunk/xwiki-annotations/xwiki-annotation-core/src/main/java/org/xwiki/annotation/internal/renderer/ 18:53  what class? 18:53 <+lucaa> what class what? 18:53  do I need to modify? 18:53 <+lucaa> to do what? 18:54  to make it work 18:54 <+lucaa> I don't know what the problem is 18:54 <+lucaa> so I don't know 18:55 <+lucaa> I'm wondering if that test can be caused by platform encoding... 18:55 <+lucaa> can you download a fresh annotations module and build it separately, without your local changes? 18:56  my guess is that I would need to override begin/endMetaData somewhere 18:56 <+lucaa> just to make sure that it will work 18:56  but I don't understand why 18:56  it builds fine 18:56  I'm building the whole platform every day 18:56 <+lucaa> ok 18:57  probably some chaniing listener 18:57 <+lucaa> the thing is, there are a lot of other annotations tests, I don't understand why only this one would fail if it's about metadata events... 18:57 <+lucaa> it would help me a lot to debug 18:58 <+lucaa> can you commit it failing and I will look at it? 18:58  yes I can do that. I can even skip it for now and you ut it back 18:58  there's a junit annotation for that 18:58 <+lucaa> but you know if you do that I will forget about it, right? 18:59  do I need to add it in your google calendar? :) 18:59 <+lucaa> you could, or ping me about it :) 18:59 <+lucaa> from time to time 18:59  It's @Ignore 18:59 <+lucaa> but especially in the evening 19:04  has joined #xwiki 19:04 <@sdumitriu> Hi degro 19:04 <@sdumitriu> What's up? 19:04  hi Sergiu! 19:04  nothing much, at home - work 19:04  :) 19:05  what about #xwiki? 19:05 <@sdumitriu> Still kicking 19:05  and what about #xe? 19:05  good to hear 19:19  http://www.google.com/buzz/NielsMayer/ficsSkFwNbF/This-looks-like-an-interesting-denial-of-service 19:26  has quit 19:32  has joined #xwiki 19:36  has quit 19:36  has joined #xwiki 20:02  has joined #xwiki 20:03  has quit 20:10  has quit 21:00  has quit 21:57  has joined #xwiki 22:04  has quit 22:12  has quit 22:24  has joined #xwiki 23:01  has quit 23:01  has quit 23:18  has joined #xwiki 23:18 <+lucaa> does anyone know how I can configure hudson to build a specific module on an agent? 23:18 <+lucaa> agent-1 seems to do nothing while the project I want to build is waiting for agent-2 23:40 <@sdumitriu> I do
